questions.text: In one epsiode, Ralph believes that he is coming into a sum of money because he has inherited a woman's "fortune". What does "fortune" prove to be?
questions.explanation:
A bird.

	Poor Ralph. He never quite hits the home run.

questions.text: In another episode, Ralph is a quiz show contestant. What is the area in which he is questioned?
questions.explanation:
Music.

	Popular music - with a memorable "introduction" by the master of the piano, Ed Norton.

questions.text: Ralph and Norton go on TV to advertise a product. What type of product is it?
questions.explanation:
Kitchen utensil.

	Great episode. Live TV - and everything goes wrong.

questions.text: Where do the Kramdens and Nortons go in an attempt to "recapture their youth"?
questions.explanation:
Roller skating.

	"I don't even mind growing old - as long as we can grow old together".

questions.text: Ralph (and others) act on stage. Who gets good reviews - and a shot at a contract?
questions.explanation:
Alice.

	Ralph wants the big break (again), but Alice is the one who gets noticed.

questions.text: What does Ralph pawn in order to get a Christmas gift for his wife?
questions.explanation:
Bowling Ball.

	"The Gift of the Magi".

questions.text: Ralph is upset when a single male neighbor moves into his building. What is the neighbor's line of work?
questions.explanation:
Dance Instructor.

	A continental man with charm and courtesy is "threatening".

questions.text: Ralph tries to win a costume contest at his lodge. Although he tries to dress up as a "man from space", the judges believe his costume to be a ...?
How do Ralph and Ed decide in which apartment their TV should be?
options: They guess the price of the tv
questions.explanation:
They flip a coin.

	"Heads I win, tails you lose."

questions.text: Ralph worries that Alice is fooling around - so he follows her when she leaves the apartment. What is Alice really doing?
